content:
Hey all,
in the past ive used the Socket library to communicate variables between processes. However it is does not seem to work with the latest Lean version and I was wondering if there is a simpler solution?
I require multiple concurrent programs (or tasks) to exchange messages, not necessarily over a network, locally would suffice.
Regards, Simon :)
@Mac Malone alloy seems to have broken again, if you fix that I'll fix socket.lean
@Henrik Böving Alloy has been bumped to the new Lean.
@Simon Daniel latest master version of socket.lean works with latest lean

cool thanks alot for your work!
however building my project still results in

info: stderr:
/home/simon/.elan/toolchains/leanprover--lean4---v4.10.0-rc2/bin/lean: symbol lookup error: ././.lake/packages/alloy/.lake/build/lib/libAlloy-Util-Server-Initialize-1.so: undefined symbol: initialize_Alloy_Util_Server_Capabilities

maybe because im on rc2 (lean-toolchain for socket says rc1)?
Running lake update automatically changes rc1 - rc2

Simon Daniel said:

Running lake update automatically changes rc1 - rc2

Are you also using Mathlib?

yes I depend on Mathlib.
looking through the logs i noticed that gcc was not installed on this machine, rebuilding with gcc seems to work now (also in combination with mathlib)
Simon Daniel has marked this topic as resolved.
